item.title: Cc Denver Police Department
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Cc Denver Police Department

Pucci Maria

This is Alexis Mendez Pérez, he was with a group of friends and was trespassing in a vacant house in Montbello.

A corrections officer named Desmond Manning mad...e the decision to shoot this boy in his back. Manning and his people are claiming that is not what happen, they are lying.

The autopsy report says he was shot in his back, there is absolutely no justification for shooting a 16 year old boy in the back.

My integrity as a human being, my values and my PALABRA are that of justice. They do not waiver, what's wrong is wrong. There is no justification for shooting a boy in the back as he ran. Alexis had no weapon, he was scared and running away.

This family lost their baby, their youngest and only boy...this family deserves justice, Alexis deserves justice!

DO YOU STAND ON THE SIDE OF JUSTICE?

#JusticeForAlexisMendezPerez

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

👀 👀

‎Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver‎ to Denver-Aurora March Against Racism & Police Violence

IMPORTANT INFO FOR TODAY’S MARCH:

There will be limited parking at the MLK Library, but lots of street parking nearby.

IF YOU ARE DRIVING WITH THE MARCH:...
• Please park wherever you are able to nearby. You can join us for the rally on foot then head back to your car afterwards, or tune into the rally livestream on our Facebook page from your car, if you prefer to remain in your vehicle.
• Please be sure to tune into our Facebook livestream for the opening rally and (IMPORTANT!) your cue when to pull onto Colfax to join the march. Cars driving with the protest will be filling in behind the marchers.
• Once the march reaches City Park, unfortunately drivers will not be able to pull up to the MLK memorial for the closing rally, as driving into the park is blocked off. We will livestream the closing rally on our Facebook page.

IF YOU ARE MARCHING ON FOOT:
• Please be aware that the march will end at City Park in Denver. You can catch the 15 RTD bus back after the closing rally at the Colfax & Elizabeth St stop. The bus comes roughly every ten minutes and goes directly East on Colfax back to the starting point (no transfers needed).
• You may also consider pairing with someone you know who is attending. One person can park near City Park in Denver, then you can drive together to the MLK Library. After the march ends, the person parked at the end point can give the other a ride back to their car.

Thanks and see you at 2PM!

See More

item.title: "On Sunday, August 23, a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man was...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"On Sunday, August 23, a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man was shot and killed by police in Belcourt, North Dakota on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation, according to a statement made by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). Law enforcement is currently providing little details about the shooting at a private residence.

The deceased is Brandon Laducer, 35, of Belcourt, North Dakota. He was a father to two children, a boy and a girl.

In an email, FBI spokesperson Kevin Smi...th shared that police were involved in a shooting at a home in Belcourt, North Dakota late Saturday night, August 22 and into the early morning hours of Sunday, August 23.

The FBI was called to respond to the shooting, and the North Dakota Bureau of Criminal Investigation assisted with processing the scene, according to the email.

The FBI reported the law enforcement agencies involved in the incident were the Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA), the Rolette County Sheriff’s Office, the Rolette Police Department and the Rolla Police Department.

Phone calls to the Rolette County Sheriff’s Department, the Rolette Police Department, and the Rolla Police Department were met with script-like responses of “that’s tribal”, leading to this reporter calling the Turtle Mountain Chippewa Tribal Office. Over the phone, a receptionist shared the phone number for the Bureau of Indian Affairs Turtle Mountain Agency and the BIA stated over the phone that any questions should be directed to the FBI field office in Minneapolis, Minnesota, nearly 500 miles away.

When asked for more information about the incident, FBI spokesperson Kevin Smith said the incident was “a shooting while officers were present” and “the circumstances of the shooting (the who, what, when, where and why) are all part of the investigation.” No other information is being shared with the public."

See the full story, which includes a detailed analysis of the complications of police interactions in Indian Country:

https://unicornriot.ninja/…/tribal-member-killed-bia-offic…/

Contributed by Darren Thompson

See MoreLittle details are known after the police killed a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man at a private residence on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation in North Dakota.

unicornriot.ninja

Tribal Member Killed, BIA Officer Suspended, Family Knows Nothing on Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation - UNICORN RIOT

Little details are known after the police killed a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man at a private residence on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation in North Dakota.Little details are known after the police killed a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man at a private residence on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation in North Dakota.

item.title: “Just 13 protesters were able to hold up delivery of materials...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

“Just 13 protesters were able to hold up delivery of materials for President Trump's controversial border fence for three hours Wednesday morning.

They showed up at 5:30 in the morning, and stood at the entrance to Stinger Bridge and Iron, blocking semi trucks from leaving the facility with steel poles destined for the border.”

The protesters said they were protesting the desecration of sacred tribal land and the impact of construction on native species and wildlife.

azfamily.com

Native American protesters block border fence material delivery

The protesters said they were protesting the desecration of sacred tribal land and the impact of construction on native species and wildlife.The protesters said they were protesting the desecration of sacred tribal land and the impact of construction on native species and wildlife.

item.title: "In March, Polis issued an executive order encouraging the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In March, Polis issued an executive order encouraging the Department of Corrections to consider releasing significant segments of its detained population. But while approximately 16,000 prisoners could have been released under this executive order, fewer than 300 actually were let out before Polis allowed key parts of the order to expire in May, according to a class-action lawsuit filed in late May by the ACLU of Colorado.

In that complaint filed in Denver District Court, th...e ACLU of Colorado asked a judge to order the Department of Corrections to either release medically vulnerable prisoners or at least better protect the medically vulnerable from the COVID-19 threat. The two sides have since agreed to a settlement of the suit, according to court filings, though the details have not been released. Citing ongoing litigation, Polis's office declined to comment on the lawsuit or other requests by decarceration advocates."

See MoreClose to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

westword.com

Advocates Urging Colorado to Release Medically Vulnerable Prisoners

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

Abolish ICE Denver

Statewide, 883 inmates have tested positive for COVID-19 and 3 have died.

When the pandemic hit Colorado, Gov. Polis issued an order allowing the early release of low-risk inmates with serious health conditions. But he's since allowed it to lapse.

item.title: "Last week, federal Judge Michael Simon ruled that...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Last week, federal Judge Michael Simon ruled that journalists and legal observers were exempt from federal officers' physical force, arrest or other treatment if the officers "reasonably know" that a person is a journalist or legal observer.

But in a 2-1 decision, the judges on the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals, agreed with the government that Judge Simon’s initial ruling was too broad."

A three-judge panel on Thursday temporarily halted protections for journalists and legal observers covering the unrest In Portland, Oregon.

abcnews.go.com

Appeals court temporarily halts protections for journalists, legal observers in Portland

A three-judge panel on Thursday temporarily halted protections for journalists and legal observers covering the unrest In Portland, Oregon.A three-judge panel on Thursday temporarily halted protections for journalists and legal observers covering the unrest In Portland, Oregon.

item.content:encoded: When we arrived to the camp near GEO, the gulch was full of dumped trash and the grass littered in glass; we cleaned up a lot last week and are coming back tomorrow and Saturday to leave the Sand Creek cleaner than we found it! Come on by with gloves, bags, water and snacks! 3130 Oakland St, Aurora
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement...
item.content:encoded:
Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) was planning an operation to target thousands of immigrant families that have received final deportation orders- a carefully coordinated push that was to target on up to 10 "sanctuary" cities across the country.

Many of us in the Coalition to Close the Concentation Camps knew that it was time to take action against forces of fascism and evil- especially for our families impacted by this broken immigration system. On July 12, 2019, radicals and impacted families split from the milquetoast Lights for Liberty vigil being conducted at the Aurora ICE Processing Center. Rebels marched into the parking lot of GEO- where anticolonial speeches were given by indigenous youth and where the now infamous flag removal occurred.

Following the flag removal and international embarrassment, the Aurora Police Department began a Twitter manhunt offering a $4k reward to identify suspects from that evening; violent crimes typically only get a $1k reward and we knew this outrageously large reward was made because two anti police flags were flown that night. Cowards at APD wouldn't fire or prosecute the murderers of Elijah McClain the following month, yet APD had the time and resources to target non-violent protestors demanding justice for immigrants.

The woman featured in this powerful photo, Michelle, was eventually identified by non profit "allies" and served misdemeanor tampering charges; Michelle's case with Aurora dragged on for over a year. Today we have some good news: our hero was found NOT GUILTY by jury trial and walks free of all charges! Fuck APD!

Michelle- you are an inspiration and a true Chingona. With you, our city sent a message to the Department of Homeland Security. Your bravery, in addition to the life Willem Van Spronsen gave on July 13th 2019 by setting ICE's kidnapping vans in Tacoma ablaze, made ICE retreat on their planned nationwide mass arrests of immigrants.

#ChingaLaMigra #AbolishICE
Photo by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the...
item.content:encoded:
"All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the authority to transfer us immediately if we want," says Jimmy Sodhi, a 45-year-old ICE detainee.

Sodhi is part of a group of eight ICE detainees who have been housed in the same dormitory at the Teller County Jail since being transferred there from the Aurora Contract Detention Facility one month ago. Sodhi and the other ICE detainees began the hunger strike on the morning of August 10 to protest what they allege are significantly worse conditions at Aurora GEO.

"As a Sikh, I'm not allowed to wear my Sikh bracelet, I'm not allowed to cover my head. If I have to pray, it's required for me to cover my head. I'm told to cover my head with a pillowcase or a towel," says Sodhi, who has been in ICE custody since March 2017 and is currently in the appeals process of his deportation case stemming from a fraud conviction for insider trading. "That is very demeaning, very disrespectful."

Sodhi notes that he was allowed to wear his turban at the Aurora detention facility, but has been told by staff at the Teller County Jail that he cannot retrieve his turban from his personal belongings. Same with prayer books, Sodhi adds, which he hasn't been able to obtain, being told by staff that "there's no chaplain here and we don't have those here."

Additionally, Sodhi contends that he and other ICE detainees at the Teller County Jail have been subjected to racial harassment perpetrated by non-ICE detainees staying in the same dormitory.

[...]

Adding to his angst, Sodhi contends that he and the other detainees don't even know why they're being housed in the Teller County Jail, which has an agreement with ICE to house immigrant detainees.

Via @denverwestword @conormichael28
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are...
item.content:encoded:
Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are still in this fight for the long haul - aka until we #FreeThemAll.

Camp Free Them All has been a success in that we: saved lives, forced Aurora GEO to be one of two detention centers in the so-called United States to be offering COVID testing, forced a congressional hearing on COVID in ICE detection centers, stopped an illegal deporation, supported families with your love & money and built so much power together this summer! ✊💖

Despite these successes, we found out last week that nearly a third of the detainees are now being quarantined due to COVID and we fully intend to keep up the pressure on GEO, ICE & DHS.

Stay tuned for our next steps at Aurora GEO and if you want to help keep impacted families out of ICE custody, please donate directly to families!

Venmo: Sanctuary-4-All
Cashapp: $abolishicedenver

Tomorrow we ask that you please come get your belongings or contact us about storage. Any items not picked up will be given to unhoused neighbors and other struggles for liberation.

And please join us for a special Sunday vigil and Pablo's birthday celebration!

https://facebook.com/events/s/pablos-birthday-vigil/749228552534363/?ti=cl
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air...
item.content:encoded:
The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air Force bases and isn't doing enough to address the threat of COVID 19 facing immigrants detained at the concentration camp in his district.

GEO and ICE cannot be trusted with the care of anyone in their custody and we demand that they #FreeThemAll
